sub_title: Chief Scientist: HR and OD @ AIHR | Thought Leadership | Human Resources Executive | Work Psychologist | Researcher | Talent | Careers | Podcaster
summary:
I love ideas, human behavior, and business. 

For the past 15+ years, I have successfully combined my interests to guide organizations in creating desirable workplaces that foster employee satisfaction and retention. Throughout my journey, I have worked with diverse organizations across EMEA, APAC, and LATAM, and have held executive-level positions such as Group Chief People Officer, Director of Consulting Services, and Chief Research Scientist.

Here's a glimpse into my current endeavors:

💼 Leading the thought leadership, subject matter expertise, and research team at AIHR to empower and educate 100,000 HR professionals by 2025.

💼 Engaging as a speaker at conferences and panels, sharing insights on strategic HR, Organizational Development (OD), and the future of work.

💼 Collaborating with industry peers on research projects that generate practical implications and drive positive change.

💼 Hosting two influential platforms: "The HR Topics" podcast series and "The HR Dialogues" videocast, where I discuss trending HR practices with esteemed guests from around the world.

💼 Contributing to the HR community through blogs, full-length articles, and opinion pieces, inspired by my global engagement with HR colleagues.

I am honoured to have received recognition for my contributions, including being named HR Executive of the Year by the CHRO Society of South Africa in 2021 and Practitioner of the Year by the South African Industrial and Organizational Psychology in 2018. Additionally, I have been acknowledged by various industry bodies for my achievements in HR strategy, leadership, digital innovation, and HR technology.

I invite you to connect with me to collaborate, exchange ideas, or explore mutual opportunities. Let's make a positive impact together. ✋🏼

treasury_media.title: The HR Dialogues #10 | Customer Centric Culture How HR Can Transform The Organization
HR OKRs: How To Get Started
The Future of Talent Management: Urgent Tipping Points and Shifts Needed to Succeed
treasury_media.description: It is estimated that the global talent shortage will continue to rise to an 85 million person shortfall by 2030. This could lead to over $8 trillion loss of revenue, placing further strain on the economy. Talent management has never been more critical for organizations than now. In fact, 78% of business executives rank talent management as high on the business agenda.

treasury_media.title: 5 Tips to Develop your HR Career | Human Resource Management
treasury_media.description: In this episode, we explore HR Careers and how they are evolving.

treasury_media.title: Is Caring Too Much Bad For Your Company Culture?
treasury_media.description:
There have been calls to reimagine employee experience, provide a new set of benefits and drive flexible workplace practices to accommodate employee preferences. The responsibility has largely been on organizations to create workplaces where people want to work, offer personalized experiences that differentiate them in a highly competitive talent market, and lead toward the coveted position of employer of choice.

This has placed HR in a difficult position.  Can we care too much?

treasury_media.title: HR Business Partnering: 5 Changes AI Will Bring
treasury_media.description: Generative artificial intelligence, including tools like ChatGPT, is creating new opportunities in Human Resources. It’s not just about increasing HR professionals’ productivity and improving HR solutions for the workforce. AI also has the potential to transform HR business partnering, pushing it towards a more strategic role.

treasury_media.title: Bridging the Gap: 3 Components for Establishing a Digital HR Capability
treasury_media.description: Emerging technologies and the digital transformation of organizations are creating a new reality for HR. Beyond just the automation of manual processes, HR has an essential role in driving the organization’s digital agenda by digitizing the employee experience, fostering digital skills, and building the business’s digital capability.
